segment.source: Use this section to learn about how to turn on and use IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: Use this section to learn about how to turn on and use IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Using IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Using IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Using IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode
segment.target: Using IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: Enterprise Mode gives you a way for your legacy websites and apps to run using emulated versions of Windows Internet Explorer 7 or Windows Internet Explorer 8, while your new sites and apps run using Internet Explorer 11, including modern standards and features.
segment.target: Enterprise Mode gives you a way for your legacy websites and apps to run using emulated versions of Windows Internet Explorer 7 or Windows Internet Explorer 8, while your new sites and apps run using Internet Explorer 11, including modern standards and features.

segment.source: Although it’s called IE7 Enterprise Mode, it actually turns on Enterprise Mode along with Internet Explorer 7 or Microsoft Internet Explorer 5 Compatibility View.
segment.target: Although it’s called IE7 Enterprise Mode, it actually turns on Enterprise Mode along with Internet Explorer 7 or Microsoft Internet Explorer 5 Compatibility View.

segment.source: Compatibility View chooses which document mode to use based on whether there’s a tag in your code:
segment.target: Compatibility View chooses which document mode to use based on whether there’s a tag in your code:

segment.source: DOCTYPE tag found.
segment.target: DOCTYPE tag found.

segment.source: Webpages render using the Internet Explorer 7 document mode.
segment.target: Webpages render using the Internet Explorer 7 document mode.

segment.source: No DOCTYPE tag found.
segment.target: No DOCTYPE tag found.

segment.source: Webpages render using the Internet Explorer 5 document mode.
segment.target: Webpages render using the Internet Explorer 5 document mode.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Because we’ve added the IE7 Enterprise Mode option, we’ve had to rename the original functionality of Enterprise Mode to be IE8 Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: Because we’ve added the IE7 Enterprise Mode option, we’ve had to rename the original functionality of Enterprise Mode to be IE8 Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: We’ve also replaced Edge Mode with IE11 Document Mode, so you can explicitly use IE11 on Windows 10.
segment.target: We’ve also replaced Edge Mode with IE11 Document Mode, so you can explicitly use IE11 on Windows 10.

segment.source: Turning on and using IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode
segment.target: Turning on and using IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode

segment.source: For instructions about how to add IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode to your webpages and apps, see:
segment.target: For instructions about how to add IE7 Enterprise Mode or IE8 Enterprise Mode to your webpages and apps, see:

segment.source: Add single sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)
segment.target: Add single sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)

segment.source: Add single sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)
segment.target: Add single sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)

segment.source: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)
segment.target: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)

segment.source: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)
segment.target: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)

segment.source: For instructions and more info about how to fix your compatibility issues using Enterprise Mode, see Fix web compatibility issues using document modes and the Enterprise Mode site list.
segment.target: For instructions and more info about how to fix your compatibility issues using Enterprise Mode, see Fix web compatibility issues using document modes and the Enterprise Mode site list.
